column3: Concept ACK. Also, I can't verify what script a maintainer runs anyway, can only verify the result. So imo it doesn't matter where this script lives.
You should link to the new script in the other repository, for transparency.
Let's add this documentation to the maintainer tools repo too so it doesn't get lost.
Might make sense to mention the `maintainer-tools` repository (here, or somewhere else in a README), and that most developer tools live there.
I've got https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/29 open to do just that üëç
Agree, will update with a reference to the maintainer tools repo.
Updated with a link to the maintainer-tools repository.
nit: s/signed by a developer/signed by a maintainer/
